info.title: AMI API
info.description:
REST service for [Animated Medical Imaging](https://github.com/niklr/animated-medical-imaging) (AMI)

## Introduction
Integrating this Application Programming Interface (API) is the easiest way to submit data to AMI. 
The following documentation will help you to get full advantage of the API by understanding and implementing all endpoints. 
With AMI API you will be able to upload files and submit tasks containing information needed for processing and receive the processed results. 
Requests with a body are sent in JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format over HTTP(S), using the PUT or POST method.

Please, feel free to ask any questions, report bugs, suggest new features, and more on [GitHub](https://github.com/niklr/animated-medical-imaging/issues)

## Authentication
Authentication of requests is accomplished by using JSON Web Tokens (JWT). Tokens can be obtained by providing your credentials to the tokens API endpoint.
If you don't have a registered account, you still can obtain tokens with the special API endpoint for anonymous users. 
The response of the tokens API endpoint contains 3 different tokens: 

- **Access Token**: An authorization credential that can be used by the application to access the API.
- **ID Token**: Contains user profile information (such as the user's name and email) which is represented in the form of claims.
- **Refresh Token**: Contains the information required to obtain a new Access Token or ID Token.

For each API request you need to include the encoded JWT Access Token with a "Bearer" prefix.

## Requests, Responses, and Errors
Status codes are issued by the API in response to a client's request made to the API.

> A **successful** completion of a request returns one of three possible status codes.

Status code | Name | Description
---- | ---- | ----
200 | OK | The default status code for successful requests.
201 | Created | Returned on successful POST requests when one or more new entities have been created.
204 | No Content | Returned on successful DELETE requests.

> An **unsuccessful** completion of a request returns one of the following status codes.

Status code | Name | Description
---- | ---- | ----
400 | Bad Request | The format of the URL and/or of values in the parameter list is not valid.
401 | Unauthorized | Usually caused by using a wrong/expired access token or by not using one at all.
403 | Forbidden | The request was valid, but insufficient permissions for the resource.
404 | Not Found | The requested entity does not (or no longer) exist.
409 | Conflict | Indicates a mismatch in the current state of the resource.
429 | Too Many Requests | Indicates that the rate limit has been reached.
500 | Internal Server Error | An exception occurred that has no adequate handling.

## HTTP method definitions
The Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) defines a set of request methods to indicate the desired action to be performed for a given resource/endpoint. 
Although they can also be nouns, these request methods are sometimes referred as HTTP verbs.
An idempotent HTTP method can be called many times without different outcomes.
AMI API makes use of the following HTTP methods:

Method | Description
---- | ----
GET | Getting a resource. (e.g. GET *https://localhost/objects/23* without body)
POST | Creating a resource. (e.g. POST *https://localhost/tasks* with a body containing JSON data)
PUT | Updating a resource. (e.g. PUT *https://localhost/tasks/7* with a body containing JSON data)
DELETE | Deleting a resource. (e.g. DELETE *https://localhost/objects/23* without body)

## Rate Limits
Requests are limited on a 60 seconds basis to provide equal access to the API for everyone.
The rate limit information is indicated in the header of the response e.g.

- X-Rate-Limit-Limit: 1m
- X-Rate-Limit-Remaining: 56
- X-Rate-Limit-Reset: 2019-07-25T09:44:13.4658862Z

## Pagination
All endpoints returning a list of entities are paginated by default.
Returning a limited amount of entities is easier to handle, instead of hundreds or thousands.

Option | Description
---- | ---- 
limit | Defines the limit to constrain the number of items. (Allowed values: 10, 25, 50)
page | Defines the current page number. (Allowed values: 0, 1, 2, ...)

## Date format
All dates are in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated) and represented in ISO 8601 format (International Organization for Standardization).

> 2019-04-17T07:52:41.4700000Z

## Webhooks
After we process and complete your request you will be notified via webhook depending on the type of request.
Dedicated resources enable you to specify new webhooks, get missed webhooks and clear missed webhooks.
For testing purposes you can use a service like [hookbin.com](https://hookbin.com/).

get.description:
With this GET request you can obtain the options used to configure the API.
It contains options related to authentication and authorization, rate limiting and others.

200.description: A model containing the API options.

get.description: With this GET request you can obtain information about the application (e.g. application name and current version).

200.description: A model containing the application information.

get.summary: Get paginated list of application logs
get.description:
With this GET request you can obtain a paginated list of application logs.
The application logs are sorted in descending order by timestamp.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit to constrain the number of items.

200.description: A model containing a list of paginated application logs.

get.description:
With this GET request you can obtain the options used to configure the application.
It contains options such as the timeout in milliseconds before a request is canceled,
the maximum amount of entries an archive is allowed to have, and others.

200.description: A model containing the application options.

get.summary: Get paginated list of audit events
get.description:
With this GET request you can obtain a paginated list of audit events.
The audit events are sorted in descending order by timestamp.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit to constrain the number of items.

200.description: A model containing a list of paginated audit events.

get.description:
With this GET request you can obtain a paginated list of objects.
The objects are sorted in descending order by creation date.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit to constrain the number of items.

200.description: A model containing a list of paginated objects.

get.description:
With this GET request you can obtain information about the object with the specified identifier.
An object is an abstraction for an uploaded file and can be processed by creating one or multiple tasks.

200.description: A model containing the specified object.

delete.description: With this DELETE request you can delete the object with the specified identifier.

post.description:
With this POST request you can upload a file in chunks in order to create an object.
If the file format consists of multiple files (e.g. Analyze or single-frame DICOM)
they have to be uploaded as single-file archive (.tar, tar.gz, .zip, .7z).
The size of a single chunk must be between 100 and 10'000 kilobytes.

parameters.name: totalSize
parameters.description: The total size of the upload.

200.description: A model containing the result of the resumable upload.

get.description:
With this GET request you can obtain a test value to verify the connection and authentication.
If the ping is successful you will receive a pong in the form of a JSON response.

200.description: A model containing the test value.

get.description:
With this GET request you can obtain information about the result with the specified identifier.
A result is an abstraction for the outcome of a finished task.

200.description: A model containing the specified result.

get.description: With this GET request you can obtain a specific image of the result with the specified identifier.
With this GET request you can download the result with the specified identifier as an archive.

200.description: A stream containing the result as an archive.

get.description:
With this GET request you can obtain information about the task with the specified identifier.
A task is an abstraction for a job being processed in the background.

200.description: A model containing the specified task.

post.description: With this POST request you can create a task being processed in the background.

requestBody.description: The command to create a new task.

201.description: A model containing the created task.

post.description:
With this POST request you can obtain tokens with your credentials.
Tokens are used for authentication and authorization purposes.

put.description: With this PUT request you can update an expired access token with a new valid access token based on the provided refresh token.

200.description: A model containing the updated tokens.

post.description:
With this POST request you can obtain tokens as anonymous user.
Tokens are used for authentication and authorization purposes.

get.description: With this GET request you can obtain information about the webhook with the specified identifier.

200.description: A model containing the specified webhook.

put.description: With this PUT request you can update a webhook.

requestBody.description: The command to update an existing webhook.

200.description: A model containing the updated webhook.

post.description: With this POST request you can create a webhook.

requestBody.description: The command to create a new webhook.

201.description: A model containing the created webhook.

get.description:
With this GET request you can obtain a paginated list of workers.
The workers are sorted in ascending order by name.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The limit to constrain the number of items.

200.description: A model containing a list of paginated workers.

validationErrors.description: Gets or sets the validation errors.

stackTrace.description: Gets or sets the stack trace.

allowedCorsOrigins.description: Gets the origins of clients (separated by a comma) that are allowed to initiate cross-origin calls.

batchSize.description: Gets the amount of entities included in a batch operation. Default is 1000.

cleanupPeriod.description:
Gets the cleanup period in minutes. Default is 0 to prevent any cleanup.
Automatically deletes objects older than the defined period.

connectingIpHeaderName.description: Gets the name of header used to identify the IP address of the connecting client.

enableRateLimiting.description: Gets a value indicating whether rate limiting is enabled. Default is false.

isDevelopment.description: Gets a value indicating whether the current environment is development.

objectLimitAnonymous.description: Gets the object limit for anonymous users. Default is 5.

objectLimit.description: Gets the object limit for regular users. Default is 0 (no limit).

requestTimeoutMilliseconds.description: Gets the amount of milliseconds before a request times out. Default is 5000.

webhookLimit.description: Gets the webhook limit per user. Default is 2.

authOptions.description: Gets the options used for authentication and authorization.

ipRateLimiting.description: Gets the options used to limit the rate based on the IP address of the client.

ipRateLimitPolicies.description: Gets the policies used to limit the rate base on the IP address of the client.

IAuthOptions.description: An interface representing options related to authentication and authorization.

allowAnonymous.description: Gets a value indicating whether anonymous authentication is allowed.

anonymousUsername.description: Gets the username for anonymous users (default is Anon).

maxRefreshTokens.description: Gets the maximum amount of valid refresh tokens a single user is allowed to store (default is 10).

expireAfter.description: Gets the amount of minutes an access token remains valid (default is 60).

jwtOptions.description: Gets the JSON Web Token (JWT) options.

userPasswords.description: Gets the passwords of system users.

IAuthJwtOptions.description: An interface representing JSON Web Token (JWT) options.

secretKey.description: Gets the secret key used to sign created tokens and to validate received tokens.

issuer.description: Gets the principal that issued the JWT.

audience.description: Gets the recipient that the JWT is intended for.

nameClaimType.description: Gets the claim representing the name.

roleClaimType.description: Gets the claim representing the role.

issuerClaimType.description: Gets the claim representing the issuer.

usernameClaimType.description: Gets the claim representing the username.

IAuthUserPasswords.description: An interface representing passwords used to configure system users.

svc.description: Gets the password for the service system user.

admin.description: Gets the password for the administrator system user.

IIpRateLimitOptions.description:
An interface representing the options to limit the rate based on the IP address of the client.
Source: https://github.com/stefanprodan/AspNetCoreRateLimit

realIpHeader.description: Gets the HTTP header of the real ip header injected by reverse proxy, by default is X-Real-IP

clientIdHeader.description: Gets the HTTP header that holds the client identifier, by default is X-ClientId

ipPolicyPrefix.description: Gets the policy prefix, used to compose the client policy cache key

IIpRateLimitPolicies.description:
An interface representing the policies used to limit the rate base on the IP address of the client.
Source: https://github.com/stefanprodan/AspNetCoreRateLimit

ipRules.description: Gets the rules to limit the rate based on the IP address of the client.

IIpRateLimitPolicy.description:
An interface representing the policy to limit the rate based on the IP address of the client.
Source: https://github.com/stefanprodan/AspNetCoreRateLimit

AppInfoModel.description: A model containing information about the application.

appName.description: Gets the name of the application.

AppLogModel.description: A model representing a log entry generated by the application.

eventId.description: Gets or sets the event identifier.

sourceContext.description: Gets or sets the source context.

PaginationModel.description: A model containing information about the pagination.

limit.description: Gets or sets the limit to constrain the number of items.

total.description: Gets or sets the total amount of items.

page.description: Gets or sets the current page number.

maxSizeKilobytes.description: Gets the maximum size in kilobytes.

maxArchivedEntries.description: Gets the maximum allowed amount of archived entries.

AuditEventModel.description: A model representing an audit event.

eventType.description: Gets or sets the type of the event.

subEventType.description: Gets or sets the type of the sub event.

xdas.description: Gets or sets the XDASv2 event.

SubEventType.description: A type to describe a sub event.

id.description: Gets or sets the identifier of the object.

createdDate.description: Gets or sets the created date.

modifiedDate.description: Gets or sets the modified date.

dataType.description: Gets or sets the type of the data.

fileFormat.description: Gets or sets the file format.

originalFilename.description: Gets or sets the original filename.

sourcePath.description: Gets or sets the source path (directory, file, url, etc.).

extractedPath.description: Gets or sets the extracted/uncompressed path (directory).

userId.description: Gets or sets the user identifier.

latestTask.description: Gets or sets the latest task.

DataType.description: A type to describe the data.

FileFormat.description: A type to describe the file format.

TaskModel.description: A model containing information about the task.

id.description: Gets or sets the identifier of the task.

createdDate.description: Gets or sets the created date.

modifiedDate.description: Gets or sets the modified date.

queuedDate.description: Gets or sets the queued date.

startedDate.description: Gets or sets the started date.

endedDate.description: Gets or sets the ended date.

message.description: Gets or sets the message describing the error.

position.description: Gets or sets the position in queue.

userId.description: Gets or sets the user identifier.

command.description: Gets or sets the command used to create this task.

result.description: Gets or sets the result associated with this task.

object.description: Gets or sets the object associated with this task.

TaskStatus.description: The different states of a task.

BaseCommand.description: The base all commands have in common.

allOf.description: A command containing information needed to process objects.

commandType.description: Gets the type of the command.

id.description: Gets or sets the identifier of the object.

CommandType.description: A type to describe the command.

AxisType.description: The different axis types of the coordinate system.

ImageFormat.description: A type to describe the image format.

BezierEasingType.description: A type to describe the Bézier curve easing.

allOf.description: A command containing information needed to process paths (directory, file, url, etc.).

commandType.description: Gets the type of the command.

sourcePath.description: Gets or sets the source path.

watermarkSourcePath.description: Gets or sets the source path of the watermark.

destinationPath.description: Gets or sets the destination path.

BaseResultModel.description: The base all results have in common.

id.description: Gets or sets the identifier of the result.

allOf.description: A model containing information about the result of the image processing.

labelCount.description: Gets or sets the label count.

size.description: Gets or sets the amount of pixels the image has in each dimension (X, Y, Z).

gifs.description: Gets or sets the axis containers of the GIF images.

combinedGif.description: Gets or sets the combined GIF.

ResultType.description: A type to describe the command.

allOf.description: A model containing information about the result of the processing.

createdDate.description: Gets or sets the created date.

modifiedDate.description: Gets or sets the modified date.

version.description: Gets or sets the application version.

jsonFilename.description: Gets or sets the JSON filename.

pong.description: Gets or sets the pong value.

CreateTaskCommand.description: A command containing information needed to create a task.

command.description: Gets or sets the command used to create this task.

TokenContainerModel.description: A model containing the access, identifier and refresh tokens.

accessToken.description: Gets or sets the access token.

accessTokenEncoded.description: Gets or sets the endcoded access token.

idToken.description: Gets or sets the identity token.

idTokenEncoded.description: Gets or sets the endcoded identity token.

refreshToken.description: Gets or sets the refresh token.

refreshTokenEncoded.description: Gets or sets the encoded refresh token.

allOf.description: The model containing information about the access token.

exp.description:
Gets or sets the "expiration time" claim identifying the expiration time on
or after which the token MUST NOT be accepted for processing.

BaseTokenModel.description: The model all tokens have in common.

sub.description: Gets or sets the subject claim identifying the principal that is the subject of the token.

iss.description: Gets or sets the issuer claim identifying the principal that issued the token.

aud.description: Gets or sets the audience claim identifying the recipients that the token is intended for.

nbf.description:
Gets or sets the "not before" claim identifying the time before which
the token MUST NOT be accepted for processing.

iat.description: Gets or sets the "issued at" claim identifying the time at which the token was issued.

allOf.description: The model containing information about the identity token.

email.description: Gets or sets the email address.

emailConfirmed.description: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the email address is confirmed.

allOf.description: The model containing information about the refresh token.

CredentialsModel.description: A model containing the credentials for login purposes.

WebhookModel.description: A model containing information about the webhook endpoint.

id.description: Gets or sets the identifier of the webhook endpoint.

createdDate.description: Gets or sets the created date.

modifiedDate.description: Gets or sets the modified date.

url.description: Gets or sets the URL of the webhook endpoint.

apiVersion.description: Gets or sets the API version used to render events.

enabledEvents.description:
Gets or sets the enabled events for this endpoint.
Specify ['*'] to enable all events.

userId.description: Gets or sets the user identifier.

allOf.description: A command containing information needed to create a webhook.
A command containing information needed to update a webhook.

BaseWorkerModel.description: The base all results have in common.

id.description: Gets or sets the identifier of the worker.

workerName.description: Gets or sets the name of the worker.

workerType.description: Gets or sets the type of the worker.

workerStatus.description: Gets or sets the current status of the worker.

lastActivityDate.description: Gets or sets the last activity date.

currentProcessingTime.description: Gets or sets the current processing time.

lastProcessingTime.description: Gets or sets the last processing time.

WorkerType.description: A type to describe the worker.

WorkerStatus.description: The different states of a worker.

allOf.description: A model containing information about the default worker.

count.description: Gets or sets the queue count.

allOf.description: A model containing information about the recurring worker.

nextActivityDate.description: Gets or sets the next activity date.

JWT.description: Type into the textbox: Bearer {your JWT token}.
JWT.name: Authorization
